intro: Cyrtandra collarifera, commonly known as the Hawaiian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats. Cyrtandra collarifera plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, providing nectar for native pollinators.
